message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.IR

This paper deals with the problem of malware spread through websites and interventions that can be deployed by search providers. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as well as networked and distributed systems (cs.NI) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also presents a Markov model to study the spread of malware, which involves analyzing large populations of websites, and this could be considered a data science problem (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the trade-offs between infection exposure and traffic loss, which could be seen as a problem of optimization or decision-making under uncertainty, and thus could be classified under social and information networks (cs.SI).
